description: Borrowed from Late Latin dēcrētōrius (“decisive”), from Latin dēcernō (“decide, determine”).

adjectives.description: decretory (comparative more decretory, superlative most decretory)

entries.meaning: (rare or obsolete) Pertaining to an authoritative decree or final judgement.
examples: If in the decretory term of the world we shall not all dye but be changed, according to received translation, the last day will make but few graves  […]
